title: Jewelry Bonney is Kuma's Daughter
summary: A theory that Jewelry Bonney has a familial connection to Bartholomew Kuma, explaining her emotional reaction when she later encounters him.
fullText: Fans theorized that Jewelry Bonney's connection to Bartholomew Kuma, hinted at in later episodes, was more than coincidental. The theory suggested that Bonney was Kuma's daughter, which would explain her deep emotional reactions to his fate and her determination to save him. This theory was later confirmed in the manga, revealing that while Bonney is not Kuma's biological daughter, she is his adopted daughter, and he sacrificed everything to save her life.
author: One Piece Fan Community

title: Bonney's True Age and Devil Fruit Powers
summary: A theory that Jewelry Bonney uses her age-manipulating Devil Fruit to appear older than she actually is, possibly being much younger than she appears.
fullText: Fans noticed that Bonney's epithet 'Big Eater' and her behavior seemed childish despite her adult appearance. The theory proposed that she uses her Toshi Toshi no Mi (Age-Age Fruit) powers to make herself appear as an adult, but is actually much younger - possibly a child. This was later confirmed when it was revealed that Bonney was only 12 years old at the time of her introduction, using her Devil Fruit to appear as an adult.
author: One Piece Theory Community

source.title: One Piece: Manga Confirms The Bonney Child Theory

title: Bonney is a Celestial Dragon's Daughter
summary: A theory that Jewelry Bonney has Celestial Dragon heritage, which would explain the World Government's unusual interest in her capture.
fullText: Fans theorized that Bonney's biological father is a Celestial Dragon, which would explain why the World Government was particularly interested in capturing her compared to other Supernovas. The theory suggested that her mother was kidnapped by a Celestial Dragon, and Bonney was the result of that union. This was later confirmed in the manga, revealing that Bonney's mother Ginny was abducted by a Celestial Dragon and forced to become his wife, making Bonney half-Celestial Dragon by blood.
author: One Piece Theory Community

source.title: One Piece: Why Shamrock Figarland Might Be Bonney's Father

title: The Supernovas Were Created Last Minute
summary: A meta-theory based on Oda's admission that the Supernovas were a late addition to the Sabaody Archipelago arc.
fullText: Eiichiro Oda admitted in an interview that the Supernovas introduced during the Sabaody Archipelago were a last-minute addition to the series, born out of a feeling that the arc lacked interesting characters. He never expected them to become so important to the plotline. This explains why they were all introduced simultaneously in one episode rather than being gradually built up throughout the series. Despite being spontaneous creations, characters like Trafalgar Law, Eustass Kid, and Jewelry Bonney became central to future arcs.
author: Eiichiro Oda (confirmed by creator)

title: Oda Forgot About Urouge
summary: A fan theory that Eiichiro Oda has largely forgotten about Urouge, making him the least developed Supernova.
fullText: Fans have theorized that among all the Supernovas, Urouge has received the least development and appearances in the story, suggesting that Oda may have forgotten about him or doesn't have clear plans for his character. Unlike the other Supernovas who have played significant roles in major arcs (Law in Dressrosa and Wano, Kid in Wano, Bonney in Egghead, Bege in Whole Cake Island), Urouge has had minimal screen time and impact on the story since his introduction. Some fans believe it may be too late to bring him back in a meaningful way.
author: One Piece Fan Community

source.title: One Piece: I'm Pretty Convinced Oda Has Forgotten About 1 Supernova
